title: INSTYLER "WET TO DRY" INSTRUCTIONAL
transcripts: timedtext format="3"> you you if your instyler is a wet-to-dry there are some specific things to know first before using the InStyler wet-to-dry is designed to save you time in your styling regimen the InStyler wet-to-dry has all the benefits and features of the original instyler plus the addition of air intake vents designed to replace the blow drying process in your daily routine you will also get amazing results with the insider wet to dry if you blow dry first it can be used either way for the best possible results with your installer wet to dry make sure to tell dry your hair first as dry as possible using the high heat setting you can then both final dry and style your hair at the same time of course the InStyler wet to dry can also be used on completely dry hair for which you can use any of the other heat settings including high if used on damp or towel dried hair be sure to go slowly even though you are moving the unit slower you will still finish your style faster than if you were using a curling iron or a flatiron and blow drying the hair first when using on wet hair we recommend using a thermal spray or a lotion first to help prevent any thermal damage you can also use any salon quality styling products with your installer wet to dry however we do not recommend the use of any oil-based products with your in styler just like the original installer be sure to detangle the hair first after thoroughly towel drying take sections of the hair that are not too large to style we recommend starting with your under layers of the hair first use one to three inch sections at a time to assure complete drawing if styling when hair is damp a few passes on each section may be necessary the styling techniques and end results of the InStyler wet-to-dry are just the same as the original instyler with the added benefit of not having to completely blow dry the hair first before styling happy and styling
